solution_line_template: His annual salary for the first year of working is {initial_monthly_salary} x {months_per_year}= $<<{initial_monthly_salary}*{months_per_year}={first_year_annual_salary}>>{first_year_annual_salary}.

So, he received ${initial_monthly_salary} + ${monthly_increase}= $<<{initial_monthly_salary}+{monthly_increase}={increased_monthly_salary}>>{increased_monthly_salary} monthly on the second and third year of working.
Kirt's annual salary in the second and third year was ${increased_monthly_salary} x {months_per_year} = ${second_and_third_year_annual_salary}.

Thus, his total earning after 3 years is ${first_year_annual_salary} + ${second_and_third_year_annual_salary} + ${second_and_third_year_annual_salary} = $<<{first_year_annual_salary}+{second_and_third_year_annual_salary}+{second_and_third_year_annual_salary}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
